asked the Minister for Education if she will approve proposals submitted by County Wexford VEC to improve school transport facilities at post primary level for a catchment area (details supplied) in County Wexford; her views on whether the current service is inadequate; if she will investigate the quality of the bus service and if it will be replaced.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: The standard of service which is available to the pupils from the area in question is adequate in the context of the general operation of the post primary school transport scheme. In the circumstances, the additional cost which would be involved in improving the level of service would not be warranted.

I understand that a replacement bus which was used for a short period on the route in question was defective under certain weather conditions. However, I am not aware of any defects in the existing school bus which would necessitate its replacement.
asked the Minister for Education when the proposed additional classrooms for Glenderry national school, County Kerry will be sanctioned.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: My Department has agreed in principle to grant aid the extension for Glenderry national school, County Kerry. A sketch scheme for the project has been approved and a grant formally sanctioned. My Department's professional staff hope to be in a position to commence shortly the preparation of the tender documentation.
asked the Minister for Education if she will sanction the erection of a post primary school at Mercy Convent, Balloonagh, Tralee, County Kerry.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: The bills of quantity for this project have been completed and are satisfactory. The next stage is the invitation of tenders. To determine when the project may proceed further, through the issue from my Department of authorisation to seek tenders, this case must be reviewed in the context of the capital resources available.
asked the Minister for Education if she will sanction the provision of an extension to the primary school at Mercy Convent, Balloonagh, Tralee, County Kerry.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: My Department have at present under consideration proposals recently submitted by the school authorities for the completion of the scheme of extension to the primary school at Mercy Convent, Balloonagh, Tralee, County Kerry, and will convey a decision on the matter to the authorities at an early date. I shall arrange to have the Deputy informed of the outcome.
asked the Minister for Education if any grants will be sanctioned for community centres and youth centres in County Kerry in 1987 and if she will give details of such grants.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: In view of prevailing financial constraints and the need to finalise overall budgetary considerations, I am not in a position at this stage to indicate what further grant allocations, if any, will be made during this year under the relevant schemes operated by my Department.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - Finglas West (Dublin) Sports Hall.

Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education if moneys will be provided to staff the new community sports hall at Scoil Íde, Cardiffsbridge Road, Finglas, Dublin 11 to allow this very valuable facility to be used by the community; and if she is aware that £500,000 has been invested in this facility.

Speaker.hpid: Proinsias De Rossa Proinsias De Rossa
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education the progress which has been made to date to provide management for the new sports hall at Scoil Ide, Finglas West, Dublin 11, which cannot be opened to the general public until adequate management has been provided.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: I propose to take Questions Nos. 170 and 171 together. My Department is in consultation with the City of Dublin Vocational Education Committee regarding the financial, management, staffing, etc., aspects of the new community sports hall at Scoil Íde, Finglas, Dublin 11. As soon as the full information required is made available to my Department, the matter will be brought to finality as quickly as possible.
asked the Minister for Education when outstanding works will be carried out to Clogherinkoe national school, Broadford, County Kildare.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: My Department's professional staff is at present making arrangements to have outstanding works at Clogherinkoe national school, Broadford, County Kildare carried out. It is hoped that these works will commence shortly.
asked the Minister for Education the present position with regard to the provision of an extension and extra facilities at Kilcock girls primary school, County Kildare.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: My Department in June 1986 sanctioned a grant for the proposed extension and extra facilities to Kilcock girls primary school, County Kildare. My Department is currently in consultation with the Rev. Chairman regarding extra works which he wishes to have carried out at the school and when this aspect of the matter is resolved my Department's professional staff will be asked to proceed with preparation of the tender documentation for the project.
asked the Minister for Education the present position regarding the proposed extension of three classrooms and a general purposes room to the national school at Rathmore, County Kildare.
asked the Minister for Education when the working drawings and bill of quantities for the proposed extension to Rathmore national school, County Kildare will be produced by her Department.

asked the Minister for Education the present position with regard to the provision of an extension to Rathmore national school, Naas, County Kildare; whether work has commenced on the preparation of working drawings and bills of quantities; whether this work is likely to commence in the near future; and if not, the reason for the delay.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: I propose to take Questions Nos. 174 to 176, inclusive, together.

My Department's professional staff has been requested to prepare tender documentation for the proposed extension to Rathmore national school, County Kildare, commencing with the working drawings. It has not been possible to attend to this work hitherto because of pressure of other commitments. I have, however, noted the Deputies' concern and have asked that work on the documentation be commenced as soon as possible.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - County Donegal School.

Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education the up-to-date position regarding the proposed extension to Carrick Vocational School, County Donegal.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: Approval to prepare the tender report for the proposed extension was conveyed to the County Donegal Vocational Education Committee on 9 March 1987. On receipt of this report and after its examination in the building unit the next stage would be the placing of the contract.

MainHeading.P: However, to determine when the project may proceed to contract, through the issue from my Department of the necessary authorisation, this case must be reviewed in the context of the capital resources available.

Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education the reason for the delay in building an extension to Letterfrack national school, County Galway.

asked the Minister for Education if she is aware that her Department estimates the cost of building an extension to Letterfrack national school, County Galway at £70,000 while local contractor's estimate of the work £40,000; and if she will make a statement on the matter.
asked the Minister for Education when sanction will be given for an extension to Letterfrack national school.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: I propose to take Questions Nos. 178 to 180, inclusive, together.

Some detailed discussions were necessary between the authorities of Letterfrack national school, County Galway, and my Department on the question of the schedule of accommodation for the proposed extension to the school. Following recent agreement on this matter, my Department is now in a position to formally sanction a grant for the project and will shortly write to the school authorities in the matter. The project will then proceed to the preparation of tender documentation. It is not the practice of my Department to disclose the financial details of individual projects which are the subject of grant applications. This information is treated as confidential between the school authorities and my Department. I can, however, say that local contractors would have the opportunity in due course in tendering for the project, as tenders would be sought by notice in the public press.

asked the Minister for Education if transport facilities will be provided for a person (details supplied) in County Wexford as was previously the case, in view of the fact that it does not involve any extra cost.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: I am having inquiries made about this case and I will advise the Deputy of the outcome in due course.

asked the Minister for Education if she will give consideration to the request by St. Mary's girls' national school, Dublin 3, for the appointment of a concessionary teacher to the school for a few months, in view of the fact that the enrolment numbers will be adequate after summer for a permanent appointment along these lines; and if she is aware of the local support outlined in a recent petition by parents and friends of the school in this respect.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: The current enrolment in this school is substantially below the level required to re-establish the post of second assistant.
My Department's position has already been explained in response to representations in this matter.
It would not be open to me to depart from the requirements of the rules in the case.

asked the Minister for Education if she will authorise private interests to run or to become involved in the running of new regional technical colleges on a contract basis as productivity has been declining in higher education, despite increasing student numbers.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: The present position is that RTCs are run by boards of management which are subcommittees of VECs. I am, at present, examining possible ways of increasing the independence of the colleges without radically altering their position within the VEC structure.

The terms of the Deputy's question suggest that a measure of control over these public institutions would be exercised by private bodies. Any detailed consideration of an issue such as that raised by the Deputy would require much more information than is available in the question.
On the matter of a decline in productivity in higher education my information would not support the Deputy's inference in that regard.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - County Kerry Schools.

Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education if she will sanction a grant for a new school at Kilcummin, Inchicullane, Killarney, County Kerry.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: In 1984 my Department sanctioned a grant towards the cost of the proposed improvements and extension to the national school at Kilcummin, Inchicullane, Killarney, County Kerry. Contract documents for the project have been completed and the invitation of tenders will now be considered in the light of my Department's financial allocation for primary school buildings in 1987.

asked the Minister for Education the present position regarding the proposed new community school for Kenmare, County Kerry; whether a green field site will be made available for same; and if she will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: The present position regarding the proposed new community school for Kenmare is that architectural planning of the development is proceeding in my Department.

MainHeading.P: The community school will be developed on the Holy Cross secondary school site and will utilise some of the secondary schools's existing good facilities. Some new buildings will also be provided. The proposed development will provide accommodation of a high quality and character.
The question of providing the community school on a green field site does not, therefore, arise.

Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education if provision has been made for funds for the construction of a sports hall approved for Killinarden community school, Killinarden, Tallaght, County Dublin, when work is likely to commence; and if she will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: A physical education hall has been approved for Killinarden community school and it is intended that it will be constructed to a standard plan prepared by my Department's consultants. This plan which is at present being revised by my Department's consultants to incorporate certain improvements, is expected to be available shortly.
When the project is ready to go to tender, the case will be reviewed in the context of available resources.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - Extension of County Kildare School.

Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education the present position regarding the proposed extension at Meanscoil Iognaid Ris, Naas, County Kildare; the exact nature of the extension and facilities; if it is proposed to proceed with the work in the near future; and the number of stages of the project still outstanding before proceeding to contract.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: (1) The present position is that my Department awaits the submission of stage 2 (outline sketch scheme) for the project from the school authorities.
(2) The area of the proposed extension is 1170 m². It is to include the following facilities:—
1 General Classroom
1 Geography Room
1 Science Laboratory/Prep Resource area
1 Woodwork/Building Construction Room
1 Social Studies Room
1 Mechanical Drawing Room
P.E. Hall/P.E. Ancillary Changing etc.
Ancillary Accommodation
(3) It is not possible to say, at this stage, when construction will begin.
(4) The following are the stages of planning to be completed before construction can commence:—
Stage 2 Outline Sketch Scheme
3 Developed Sketch Scheme
4 Working Drawings
5 Bills of Quantities
6 Tender Action and Report.

asked the Minister for Education the up-to-date position concerning additional accommodation at Ballinree national school, County Tipperary; when final approval will be granted; and when construction will commence.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: Tender documentation for the proposed new national school at Ballinree, County Tipperary, has been prepared. The question of inviting tenders for the project is now arising for consideration, subject to final clarification of the 1987 level of funding in favour of my Department for the national schools building programme. A decision on the matter will be conveyed as soon as possible to the school authorities.
asked the Minister for Education the proposals if any, she has for the introduction of teaching assistants.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: My Department have no plans to introduce a scheme of the type referred to by the Deputy.
